thread.title: Jet Edge takes delivery of two new large cabin Gulfstreams
thread.title_full: Jet Edge takes delivery of two new large cabin Gulfstreams

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Jet Edge takes delivery of two new large cabin Gulfstreams
text:
Jet Edge takes delivery of two new large cabin Gulfstreams Adv: 
Jul 21, 2015 Adv: 
LOS ANGELES, CA - Jet Edge International welcomes two West Coast based Large Cabin Aircraft to its expanding fleet. These two Gulfstream join the 28 aircraft that Jet Edge currently has available for charter based in the United States. The newly delivered GV and GIVSP will both be based in Los Angeles at Van Nuys airport. 
The GV features a forward private office for three, and an entirely refurbished interior as of June 2015. In addition to the main cabin that houses six individual seats, the aft portion of the aircraft provides two four-seat divans and a fully enclosed lavatory. The plane’s full forward galley features both a microwave and coffee/espresso maker for passengers’ onboard catering needs. In addition to enjoying a lavish cabin with earth-tone leather seating for up to 17, passengers will be entertained onboard with the aircraft’s 10 monitors, dual DVD drive and 10-stack CD player. The maple woodwork and gold finishes are beautiful touches in this Wi-Fi and Talk & Text equipped aircraft. 
The GIVSP offers a 13 passenger seating configuration with a four-place club arrangement in the forward cabin. The mid cabin houses two-person club seating while the aft cabin contains a three-place divan and four-place conference group seating. In addition to the aft galley and full-service lavatory, the aircraft houses a separate forward crew galley and lavatory. The aircraft’s interior, refurbished in 2011, features a double-sided galley outfitted with oven, microwave, coffeemaker and espresso machine. The aircraft, which berths 5 to 6, is equipped with Wi-Fi, Talk & Text and a deluxe entertainment system. 
“These recent fleet additions continue to accelerate our current growth plan of large cabin aircraft for charters worldwide,” said David Erich, President and COO. 
“Jet Edge is fast becoming a leader in sourcing and buying/selling aircraft for prospective owners and current fleet customers, and with these two additions, we will have facilitated the purchase of 14 aircraft in the past 12 months,” said Bill Papariella, CEO of Jet Edge.
